# Draft:Hinton Battle Day of Dance

= Hinton Battle Day of Dance =
Hinton Battle Day of Dance is an annual free dance and mentorship event held in New York City to honor the legacy of three-time Tony Award winner Hinton Battle. Launched in June 2024 and co-produced by Black Broadway Men, the Black Theatre Coalition, and La Pope, Inc., the event features professional-led masterclasses, a panel discussion, and awards recognizing excellence in dance.
Background and History
Inaugural Event – On June 10, 2024, the first Day of Dance took place at Open Jar Studios in Manhattan, offering free masterclasses across genres—ballet, Horton, jazz/hip-hop, Fosse®, and tap—taught by esteemed instructors such as Robert Battle, Tracy Inman, Edgar Godineaux, Lloyd Culbreath, and John Manzari.
Following its success, the second annual Day of Dance was held on June 30, 2025, expanding programming and formalizing two awards: the HB-DoD Legacy Award and the HB-DoD Rising Star Award.
